org.orgName: District Court of the United States

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRINCT OF WASHINGTON.
SAM PLASTINO vs. HENRY M. WHITE, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, Washington. No. 3393 WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES TO HENRY M. WHITE, ESQUIRE. UNITED STATES COMMISSIONER OF IMMIGRATION, at Seattle, Washington.

WE COMMAND YOU That you have the body of Sam Plastino, by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatever name he shall be called or charged, efore the District Court of the United States in and for the Western District of Washington, in the city of Seattle, on the 5th day of August, 1916, at ten o'clock, in the forenoon of that day, to do and receive what shall then be considered concerning the said Sam Plastino; and have you then, there this writ.
WITNESS The Honorable EDWARD M. WHITE, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, the 3rd day of August, 1916.
Clerk of the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.
